title: I really hope that riot games will be one day a monolith of the game industry however...
body:
Beck, Merill, guinsoo, pendragon, Coronach, Volty, ezreal, morello : 

Those guys worked hard to make one of the biggest games in the world. 

Riot Games and league of legends has been threw very difficult phases in the past but they never left down players and always tried to keep quality even with low budget.

Those guys could make you a triple A game without huge $ investiments because they invested their free time, their life for the game. They wanted it to be a succes and hoped for a better future. Thank to this mentality they cared a lot for the players feedback. When community had suggestions or wasn't happy they didn't lose time : they directly communicated and announced changes.

Nowadays morello doesn't work on lol anymore and one of the worst thing that happened to league was Coronach departure from riot games. This guy alone has created around 1/5 of lol champions and his designs were rock solid. Since he left riot lost a monolith in champion designs and developpment. The new unexperimented rookies wanted new approachs and innovative designs... the unexperience of those created a lot of mess in the game.


What i find terrible is that those guys i mentionned before they made a triple A game without a lot of money and got it close to be balanced.

Nowadays riot makes 1.6 billions a year and does worse than riot and lol at his beginning. Riot has now high budget but the quality by the actual strandards of gaming industry is very low.


2014 : new map rework
2018 : changes on the old chest keys system which was way more friendly to the players
2018 : still a lot of old champions to visually or to gameplay update
2017-18 : popular champions favorised by gameplay improvement and skin comception
2018 : destruction of a processus of balance that took around 9 years to be optimized 
Every champion was meant to be balanced around runes and masteries.
2018 : crazy metas, crazy champion designs, unfinished and non polished ideas that were brought live.
2018 : extremely low communication with players, non consideration of players feedback, riot had to wait the rage streamers and of the pro players to began to act...
2018 : the massive amount of players lost have brought them to unbann permantly banned accounts.


Does all of this looks like a 1.6 billion profit a year gaming company ?

You are trying to be like blizzard but you are getting closer to ea games.

As i said earlier the guys mentionned at beginning made it better faster and with higher quality (for its time) with perhaps only 1/100000 of the profits riot currently has.

The uptades were better they focalized on the players need and feedback. The communication was better and they didn't wait 6 months to makes big changes going in the direction of the community. If players were massively complaining about something the next week it was solved.

So tell me why do you do worse with more money, more employees and with a big reputation ? In the past riot games worked way better.

Did you decide to rest on your laurels and to wait for money coming from the sky ?

Blizzard would have updated visually all the existing champions one month. In 2 months they would have updated all the old existing kits. It has been 4 years now since map update and the promise to update all champion
we still have potato malphite, kite anivia, toilet paper amumu, 3bit caitlyn, candy skarner, flintstone udyr, power rangers pantheon etc...

You want to look like the amazing blizzard, rockstar games or even ncsoft ?

Well you are light years aways from the speed and ratio quality/speed they work.
They work fast/ they adapt fast to their communities/ and they release high quality content at high speed.

Riot you are more like an old diesel engine. By working slow your content quality should be way higher than the companies listed above. But you can't. You tried this year to release content way faster than in the past it was a big failure. Why ?

You need to listen to your gaming comunity and you need to hire experienced employees and some rookies that will be formed by the old guys.

This year was really bad but not a failure because you finally reacted !

Don't become like ea and everything should be fine. I hope for you all the success possible because i do love riot games and its game league of legends. What i hate it's when riot games try to alienate his game to bring more players to it.

Let's hope for a good season 9 and that we players and riot games will continue to walk together and with communication this time.

::Creates most popular game in the history of the world::

"Hey guys, we really need to _innovate_ this product"

The popularity actually originated in the innovation. The entire project was based on the idea that instead of a gaming company diversifying by creating many games, they could basically update the same game in ways that made it a new game. Aka verticle development rather than horizontal.

That's WHY it's so successful.

If they had produced multiple games:

-They would compete with one another.
-They would have less manpower to devote on any one game's success, creating back logs, lack of support/feedback, and content.
-They wouldn't be able to E-Sport.
-The earlier games would already be in Legacy status (League being one of them).
-Prices per game would be MUCH higher.
I would be hesitant in looking up to blizzard after seeing what they did to starcraft 2.

All champs just have recolors as "skins" with a some having actual different skins. And we aren't talking like 2 recolors, it actually around 4-5+ recolors and the skins aren't even impressive. Riot's skins have amazing art and sometimes even lore to it. The old models in LoL are an eyesore, but that shouldn't be a reason to say Riot isn't listening to the community.

You do realize Tencent has owned Riot from its onset? Even in its Angel Investor Phase Tencent was a 30% Investor, before they bought it outright during League's development.

In other words, it's been under the exact same management since its inception, other than developers.

And, you need to realize something to understand the way these games are managed:

The market for MOBAs/multiplayer games is overcrowded and competitive, and generally, companies invested in them are moving away from them, because there is a high operational profit risk. Games only make up about 2.1 Billion of Tencent's 21 Billion Profit per year. What they are actually invested in is telecommunications, networking, and software development.

So..... Tencent is beginning to treat its gaming wing as something they calculate as less reliable revenue than other sources. They only mention 2 of their games in their annual reports: League of Legends and Dungeon Fighter. They own over 10,300 games.

That should indicate what a blockbuster their investment in Riot was, and still is.

They're adjusting their market models to compensate for a seasonally adjusting player base and to gain more revenue out of each player. That's part of the business.

But ..... it's always been there too.

This was a pretty good post for the first third. And I want to agree with some of the other stuff, but you're making it really hard with bullshit like this:

> 2018 : changes on the old chest keys system which was way more friendly to the players

Chest and keys basically haven't changed at all. The only difference that I know of is the addition of honor check points, which are an improvement to clarity and transparency if anything. Oh, and [these small changes](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/developer-corner/zKItWb9m-champ-mastery-costs-masterwork-chests-and-some-loot-buffs), which all seem like buffs to me.

> 2018 : still a lot of old champions to visually or to gameplay update

Yeah, because Riot actually has decent standards now. The old one-new-champion-per-patch cadence is the entire reason that we have so many shitty, old champions in the first place. Good work takes time, no matter how big your company is. Do you want quality, or do you want more Karma reworks? (Sorry Scarizard, it wasn't your best work)

> 2017-18 : popular champions favorised by gameplay improvement and skin comception

Why wouldn't Riot focus more on the champions that people enjoy? They make more people happy that way. And it's not like they are leaving other champions in the dust forever. Not even counting the complete reworks, I've seen plenty of new skins, lore, and small balance changes given to old champions recently. Yorick, MF, and Volibear (respectively) are just a few good examples.

> 2018 : destruction of a processus of balance that took around 9 years to be optimized
Every champion was meant to be balanced around runes and masteries.

Arguing in favor of the new runes is a pretty in-depth task that I'm not going to attempt here. But I can say that they haven't affected "processes of balance" at all. Champions are still balanced around their best rune setups, and if a rune is too strong, it's obvious (too many champions use it/it made those champions generally dominant) and it gets fixed. This isn't new. The same shit has been happening forever with masteries and items.

> 2018 : crazy metas, crazy champion designs, unfinished and non polished ideas that were brought live.

I'll agree on the first two. (Although I personally don't have a problem with the "crazy" designs, I understand Riot is pushing too hard on that front, for most players.) However, it's not fair to call any of it unpolished. There's always been a huge amount of "live testing" when it comes to League (and a lot of other online games). It's not realistic to expect new features/champions to be perfectly tuned (especially the crazy ones). It's an iterative design process, that involves player feedback, which they get a ton of **after** release. PBE can only get them so far, given the small playerbase and terrible match quality.

Could Riot spend 3 more months on every champion/feature/issue, to make sure it's perfect? Probably, but that would slow down the overall rate of improvements and new content by a lot. It's not a workflow I would advocate for. I'd rather have slightly unfinished designs, that are perfected quickly thanks to feedback from live players.

> 2018 : extremely low communication with players, non consideration of players feedback, riot had to wait the rage streamers and of the pro players to began to act...

There is no way this can be objectively argued for or against. It's entirely up to perception and expectations, compared loosely with other games/companies that don't even work the same way. All I can say is that I continually see Riot fix 80% of the hot-button complaints in the game. (The other 20% being infeasible to fix, or just stupid.) It's just takes them a while. Maybe too long... In any case, "extremely low communication" and "non consideration of feedback" are waaaay off target.

> 2018 : the massive amount of players lost have brought them to unbann permantly banned accounts.

Do you honestly think Riot is experimenting with unbanning players because they need more players? I've tried to be respectful with the rest of my comment, but that is actually ridiculous. Less than 1% of player get permabanned in the first place, so unbanning them would be a drop in the bucket. Seriously, unbanning players is such an incredibly bad business decision for so many reasons... Anyone who thinks Riot is unbanning people for any reason besides pure good-faith or generosity is sorely mistaken. I guess you could argue it's a good PR move, but any kind of AD campaign would be 10x better for their bottom-line if that's what they really cared about.

> You are trying to be like blizzard but you are getting closer to ea games.

EA isn't even a game developer. They are a publisher. Regardless, I get your meaning, and I reject that as well. League of Legends is still a free-to-play game. With free loot. And the recent addition of free runes. And skins may be a bit more expensive now-a-days, but it's largely because they are higher quality. Speaking of which, even when champions get VGUs, their old shitty skins get updated/improved too without increasing those skin prices. Riot is nothing like EA.

Bring on the "Riot fanboy" comments. Riot is fine company to be a fan of, IMO.
